description: A proposition is a formal proposal for changing a law, or create a new one.
Is the content of the Proposition.

A document (noun) is a bounded physical representation of body of information designed with the capacity (and usually intent) to communicate. A document may manifest symbolic, diagrammatic or sensory-representational information. (From http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/Document)
Universal Resource Identifier of a document (From: http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/uri)
The Disposition on which the Proposition will be voted.
The Proposition that there is the object of this Disposition.
The nature of the disposition.
A Session is an event on which Dispositions are voted.
The Session in which the vote event occurs.
A VoteEvent is na  event inside a Session on which a Disposition is voted
The date when the VoteEvent begins.
The summary of the VoteEvent.
The Disposition will be voted on the VoteEvent.
The Recommendation of a group on the voting object.
The VoteEvent on which there is a recommendation.
The Group that made the recomendation.
The teor of the Recommendation or of the Vote.
The Group class represents a collection of individual agents (From: http://xmlns.com/foaf/spec/#term_Group)
A rule or a system of rules that a particular country or community recognizes as regulating the actions of its members and may enforce by the imposition of penalties.
The number of the Law.
The year of the Law.
The Vote is the formal opinion of the agent about a disposition.
The one who votes.
The VoteEvent on which this vote was voted.
